page.title: 15AGRICULTURAL SUPPLIERS
page.content: "SELLAR'S" was built here in 1978 because Letham is central in an agricultural area. It sells new and second-hand tractors, combine and potato harvesters, ploughs and other farm machinery, also workwear and tools. There is a large workshop for servicing and repair of machinery. Sellar's can also make parts in their workshop. Customers come from all over Angus, Perthshire and even Orkney and Shetland Isles.They also trade abroad, selling second-hand equipment to Ire- land and Turkey while machinery is imported from East Germany. Twenty-two permanent workers, increasing to twenty-five when busy, are employed by the company which originated 160 years ago in Huntly, Aberdeenshire. There are branches in Maud, Blairgowrie, Laurencekirk and Oldmeldrum.
